intro: Oldenlandia rutshuruensis, commonly known as the Congo milkweed, is a flowering plant native to central Africa. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its small, white or pale pink flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant has opposite, ovate leaves with a hairy surface, and it thrives in moist, shaded environments. It is often found in forest understories and along stream banks, where it plays a role in local ecosystems. Due to its ornamental value and medicinal properties, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens.
